weather_report:
A clear, uncomplicated morning is settling over Katy, the sky already rinsed clean and brightening with an easy, winter light. The sun will stay generous through midmorning and into midday, with visibility crisp and untroubled by haze. UV is gentle now and will nudge toward moderate by lunchtime; sunglasses and a dab of sunscreen won’t be wasted. The day reads as quietly pleasant rather than balmy—cool enough at daybreak to want a light layer, then contentedly comfortable as the hours slide forward. Expect the clarity to hold, the kind of blue that makes windows seem too small.

Dress in layers you can shed—light jacket, long sleeves, and comfortable shoes. It’s a good morning to open the blinds, let the house drink in the sun, and take a brief walk with coffee in hand. If you’ve errands, make them late morning when the air feels kind; if you’re home, step outside to tighten a loose hinge, sweep the porch, or sort the week’s recycling. With the sky so steady and unruffled, even routine chores take on a small sense of ceremony.
